content: meeting in ~20 minutes; mostly expecting to check in on blog post and the queue triage work this week
(gonna miss it as i'm in a meeting)
@T-release meeting!
ok - let's get started
@DPC triage checkin?
Not much to report. Haven't worked on the triage numbers yet
@XAMPPRocky I think was going to do some work there?
I havenâ€™t started on that, was mostly focused on the blog post this week, but I do have some questions about the script that we can discuss after the meeting.
ok - I have another meeting right after this, but happy to sync up at some point.
Let's move to blog post then - do we have a list of topics in mind yet? what's our progress so far?

Re: Blog post

I have been working on it this week, I plan to share a draft PR by Sunday/Monday. The topics I decided to write about are

  • Const generics
  • Cargoâ€™s new feature resolver
  • split debuginfo
did the resolver stabilize? (I guess I missed that), but this seems good
that sounds amazing as a timeline though!
Apparently, Eric Huss shared the stabilisation PR in the relnotes PR
ok great!
awesome :)
ok - let's see, I think that's all then -- @triagebot end-meeting ?

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
I have
(can't see the wrench emoji :/)
ok, go ahead
this is a small thing, but I'd propose adding "notify people who post on social media" at the top of the release process for release day
mostly to make sure we don't know who will tweet once the blog post is up

hm, so it's non-obvious to me that we need it to be us and/or that we need that to necessarily happen immediately, but it seems reasonable to add. I think a list of folks to ping would be needed, in that case.
I can work on a list
would you be up for filing a pr with that?
yep!
sounds great. ok, let's @triagebot end-meeting again :)

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.

Sounds good to me, should we try to write the tweet ahead of time, so that whoever it is can just copy paste it, and then it removes the pressure from that person to try to write something in a short time?
(do we not have a standard format? I assumed we did, but documenting it seems great)
there is a semi-standard format I use when posting tweets on my own, but for example steve has a different style
I think if possible we should let who actually tweets to come up with a message, to avoid them being just who copy/pastes the message
I think having a default (or some set of defaults) is useful
but people personalizing also seems fine.
how about I ask steve (who usually tweets) what he'd prefer and then report back next week?
sounds good, or feel free to just cc on PR or so
Yeah, Iâ€™m all for personalisation, itâ€™s just not always the easiest thing to do. ðŸ™‚
okay, I think that was all - thanks everyone! :wave:
@XAMPPRocky don't miss the const generics blog post that just went up... something for you to reference in the release post, at least.
